passage_text: Nurses with 10 to 19 years of neonatal nursing experience earn high annual salaries, averaging between $80,901 and $104,313 per year. The most experienced neonatal nurse practitioners, 20 or more years of work experience, on average earn more than $111,000 per year. When contemplating a career in nursing, one of the factors that should be considered is that of a nurse’s salary and benefits. According to the Bureau of Labor Statistics, the median annual wage for a registered nurse in 2013 was approximately $65,470.

Salary. The average yearly salary for a nurse specializing in labor and delivery is approximately $55,000 a year. A labor and delivery nurse who has several years of experience can expect to make closer to $70,000 or more. Those nurses with a master’s degree or higher can also make a significantly higher annual salary. The annual pay level for a labor and delivery nurse is often higher in metropolitan areas verses rural areas.

Average Pay for RNs. According to the Bureau of Labor Statistics, registered nurses in all specialties earned an average of $67,930 per year as of 2012. Half of all RNs made between $25.80 and $37.84 per hour and reported annual earnings ranging from $53,670 to $78,700 per year. Those working in the Southeast earned an average of $64,700 per year as of 2011, according to ADVANCE. Those in the Mid-Atlantic and Great Lakes States averaged $70,618 per year, while specialty-certified maternal-child nurses working in the Midwest earned an average salary of $71,000.

A Labor and delivery nurse’s salary can span a wide range, making it a bit more difficult to pinpoint just how much Labor and Delivery nurses make. On average, their salaries are set anywhere from $40,000 to 90,000 per year depending on experience, education, employer and location. When contemplating a career in nursing, one of the factors that should be considered is that of a nurse’s salary and benefits. According to the Bureau of Labor Statistics, the median annual wage for a registered nurse in 2013 was approximately $65,470.

Average labour and delivery nurse salary. The median wage of Labour and Delivery Nurse in the United States is around $59,725 per annum. The hourly average of Labour and Delivery Nurse is from $20.21 to $39.07 while the average overtime is from $10.07 to $60.82. A Labour and Delivery Nurse in the US can earn a top yearly bonus of $2,031. Labour and Delivery Nurse with 10 to 19 years of experience earn from $25.78 – $43.89 per hour and those with 20 plus years of experience earn from $21.96 – $41.11 per hour. labour and delivery nurse salary.

Pay By Metropolitan Area. The top-paying metropolitan area for labor and delivery nurses in 2009 was Visalia-Porterville, CA, which paid an average of $111,030 a year, according to the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics. National Pay. The average pay for labor and delivery nurses in the United States in 2009 was $66,530 a year, according to the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics. This is a 6.5 percent increase since 2007.

A newly practicing labour and delivery nurse can receive a starting yearly minimum salary of $45,000. As labour and delivery nurse gains more years experience the salary increases considerably. A Labour and Delivery Nurse practicing for 10-19 years can receive up to $120,000 salary including perk/benefits and bonuses. Labour and Delivery Nurse with 10 to 19 years of experience earn from $25.78 – $43.89 per hour and those with 20 plus years of experience earn from $21.96 – $41.11 per hour. labour and delivery nurse salary.

Annual salaries for pediatric nurses are also influenced by specialization. For example, labor and delivery pediatric nursing specialists typically earn anywhere from $24,000 to 65,000 annually. Acute care specialists earn the highest annual salaries among pediatric nurses, $50,000 to 75,000 per year. When contemplating a career in nursing, one of the factors that should be considered is that of a nurse’s salary and benefits. According to the Bureau of Labor Statistics, the median annual wage for a registered nurse in 2013 was approximately $65,470.
